div.bibl: Daily Jewish Courier, May 17, 1917. IN THE CHICAGO HEBREW INSTITUTE

body.p: A series of lectures for children, to be held every Tuesday evening during the summer season has been arranged by the Institute. The first lecture, held last Tuesday, was well attended by the children. The subject was "Alaska."
On Sunday evening the Literary Dramatic Society will carry through a Sholom Aleichem [famous author] memorial evening in the institute.
A suitable program has been arranged.
